content: hello fellow crafters welcome to the craft I have an interesting concept for
you today think about this for a minute say you had tables and desks that you
could change out the top so what that means is you don't have to make a
separate table and desk for every single different top you have you could just
make a few and then make a bunch of different tops and just replace the tops
as needed in game or you know just before you play so or even when you're
playing so I think this is a really cool idea so let's set the table I'll show
you what I came up with to start up for this craft I got this
bag of rectangular wooden shapes and these gonna be perfect for our table
tops okay so why it is I got the smaller one the larger one I got a coffee
stirrer and cuz the length of the piece and then I have these half inch cubes
okay and I got these cubes at the craft store also so I'm going to one version
I'm going to use the cubes and I'm gonna glue the coffee stirrers to the backs of
the tables here just with white glue just with myomas glue all let that set
up for a second I'm gonna do another version where I use posts and I got
these kind of spindles and I'm going to use 3/4 inch washers for the bottom and
don't kind of give it weight and help it to stand up so I'm just going to put
some goop on here stick those to the washer and I'll let those harden up dry
up all right now my wooden pieces are dried do some more on here and put them
on the book that too on the bottom of the larger piece the larger table and
then one on the bottom of the smaller table and you know with these tables you
know you don't this is is not medieval Europe you don't have to have everything
look like medieval Europe would have four legs right okay so there's a
smaller table I'm just using one of the posts and for the larger table I'm using
two of the posts which are just the spools alright cool
now I'm going to kind of reinforce this with what some white glue go around the
edges there and you know kind of push it into the crevices that'll just give it
some extra strength and support right we don't want this to come apart at all
oops and I just put the glue around the joints there alright cool
now we'll let this dry up and then I'll paint these flat black and we'll be
ready to go okay I've painted that flat black spray painted at flat black and
these are the ones with the posts and same thing with the ones you know with
the blocks the ones that the blocks are a little shorter so I painted that put
that up with burnt umber and I'm going to use kind of a medium brown you could
really use anything you want and I'm going to kind of dry brush it on with a
stiff bristle brush and I'm going for the kind of you know wood grain on it
right it already does have some wood grain
because it actually is wood but that helps reinforce that so I'm not painting
the whole thing brown like I did with the dark the dark brown I'm just kind of
dragging the brush across the surface now I'm going to use a tan as a high
kind of a highlight and I'll hit the edges and that kind of thing and drag it
lightly across the surface here's a nice worn look so very cool all
right now finish this up and we'll hit our table and you'll see how cool the
magic trick to these interchangeable table tops so get ready here we go
alright here's our first table talk when it's like a desk and I have these chairs
you can check out my video on how to make those and here's the table but
here's the cool part I use the same piece of wood the same size as the other

have different tabletops without having to make different tables that saves you
so much work very cool let's look at some other ones ok guys so here we go
here's another one here's like a wizard's desk right and here's another

all right let's check out the next piece here set it up and bam we got another
